Body: Ta Sin Mim. 3137
Behold thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity 3144
" `Now then we have none to intercede (for us)
" `Nor a single friend to feel (for us).
" `Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of those who believe!' " 3185
Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.
And verily the Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the apostles.
Behold their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)? 3186
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust: 3187
"So fear Allah and obey me.

"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the
			Lord of the Worlds:
"The people of Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
"So fear Allah and obey me." 3188
They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that follow thee?" 3189
He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?
"Their account is only with my Lord if ye could (but) understand.
"I am not one to drive away those who believe. 3190
"I am sent only to warn plainly in public."
They said: "If thou desist not O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to death)." 3191
He said: "O my Lord! truly my people have rejected me.

"Judge thou then between me and them openly and deliver me and
			those of the Believers who are with me."
So we delivered him and those with him in the Ark filled (with all creatures). 3192

He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with
			falsehood:
Thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe. 3193
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The `Ad (people) rejected the apostles. 3194
Behold their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust. 3195
"So fear Allah and obey me.

"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the
			Lord of the Worlds.
"Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves? 3196

"And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of
			living therein (forever)?
"My breast will be straitened and my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron. 3145
"And when ye exert your strong hand do ye do it like men of absolute power? 3197
"Now fear Allah and obey me. 3198
"Yea fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know. 3199
"Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons
And Gardens and Springs.
"Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day." 3200
They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be not among (our) Admonishers! 3201
"This is no other than a customary device of the ancients 3202
"And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!"

So they rejected him and We destroyed them verily in this is a
			Sign: but most of them do not believe.
"And (further) they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me." 3146
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Thamud (people) rejected the apostles. 3203
Behold their brother Salih said to them: "Will you fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.

"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the
			Lord of the Worlds.

"Will ye be left secure in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have
			here?--
"Gardens and Springs
"And corn-fields and date-palms with spathes near breaking (with the weight of fruit)? 3204
"And ye carve house out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.

Allah said: "By no means! proceed then both of you with Our
			Signs; We are with you and will listen (to your call).
"But fear Allah and obey me;
"And follow not the bidding of those who are extravagant 3205
"Who make mischief in the land and mend not (their ways)."
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched! 3206

"Thou art no more than a mortal like us: then bring us a Sign if
			thou tellest the truth!"
He said: "Here is a she-camel: she has a right of watering and ye have a right of watering (severally) on a day appointed. 3207

"Touch her not with harm lest the Penalty of a Great Day seize
			you."
But they hamstrung her: then did they become full of regrets. 3208

But the Penalty seized them.  Verily in this is a Sign: but most
			of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.

"So go forth both of you to Pharaoh and say: `We have been sent
			by the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
The people of Lut rejected the apostles. 3209
Behold their brother Lut said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.

"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the
			Lord of the Worlds.
"Of all the creatures in the world will ye approach males.

"And leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your mates?
			Nay ye are a people transgressing (all limits)!"
They said: "If thou desist not O Lut! thou wilt assuredly be cast out!" 3210
He said: "I do detest your doings." 3211

"O my Lord! deliver me and my family from such things as they
			do!"
" `Send thou with us the Children of Israel.' "
So We delivered him and his family all
Except an old woman who lingered behind. 3212
But the rest We destroyed utterly.
We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)! 3213
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Companions of the Wood rejected the apostles. 3214
Behold Shuaib said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)? 3215
"I am to you an apostle worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.
(Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life? 3147

"No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the
			Lord of the Worlds.
"Give just measure and cause no loss (to others by fraud). 3216
"And weigh with scales true and upright.

"And withhold not things justly due to men nor do evil in the
			land working mischief.

"And fear Him Who created you and (Who created) the generations
			before (you).
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!
"Thou art no more than a mortal like us and indeed we think thou art a liar! 3217
"Now cause a piece of the sky to fall on us if thou art truthful!" 3218
He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do." 3219
But they rejected him. Then the punishment of a day of overshadowing gloom seized them and that was the Penalty of a Great Day. 3220 3221
"And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!" 3148
Verily in that is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
And verily thy Lord is He. The Exalted in Might Most Merciful. 3222
Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds: 3223
With it came down the Spirit of Faith and Truth 3224
To thy heart and mind that thou mayest admonish 3225
In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.
Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former peoples. 3226
Is it not a Sign to them that the learned of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)? 3227
Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs
And had he recited it to them they would not have believed in it. 3228
These are Verses of the Book that makes (things) clear. 3138
Moses: "I did it then when I was in error. 3149
Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the Sinners. 3229
They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;

But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden while they
			perceive it not;
Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on? 3230
Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years

Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they
			were promised!
It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
Never did We destroy a population but had its warners
By way of reminder; and We never are unjust. 3231
"So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the apostles. 3150
No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation): 3232

It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce
			it).

Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing
			it.

So call not on any other god with Allah or thou wilt be among
			those under the Penalty.
And admonish thy nearest kinsmen
And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee. 3233
Then if they disobey thee say: "I am free (of responsibility) for what ye do!" 3234
And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might the Merciful
Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer)
And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves. 3235
"And this is the favor with which thou dost reproach me that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel" 3151
For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.
Shall I inform you (O people!) on whom it is that the evil ones descend? 3236
They descend on every lying wicked person

(Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities and most of them are
			liars.
And the Poets it is those straying in Evil who follow them: 3237
Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?
And that they say what they practice not?

Except those who believe work righteousness engage much in the remembrance of Allah and defend themselves only after they are unjustly attacked. And soon will the unjust assailants know what vicissitudes their affairs will take! 3238 3239
Pharaoh said: "And what is the `Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds?' " 3152

(Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the
			earth and all between if ye want to be quite sure."
(Pharaoh) said to those around: "Do ye not listen (to what he says)?" 3153

(Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the
			beginning!"
(Pharaoh) said: "Truly your apostle who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!" 3154

(Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West and all between! If
			ye only had sense!"
(Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me I will certainly put thee in prison!" 3155
It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief that they do not become Believers. 3139
(Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?" 3156
(Pharaoh) said: "Show it then if thou tellest the truth!"

So (Moses) threw his rod and behold it was a serpent plain (for
			all to see)!
And he drew out his hand and behold it was white to all beholders! 3157
(Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed: 3158

"His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then
			what is it ye counsel?"

They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while)
			and dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect
"And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day well-known 3159
And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?
If (such) were Our Will We could send down to them from the sky a Sign to which they would bend their necks in humility. 3140
"That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?" 3160
So when the sorcerers arrived they said to Pharaoh: "Of course shall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?" 3161

He said: "Yea (and more) for ye shall in that case be (raised to
			posts) nearest (to my person)."
Moses said to them: "Throw ye that which ye are about to throw!" 3162
So they threw their ropes and their rods and said: "By the might of Pharaoh it is we who will certainly win!" 3163
Then Moses threw his rod when behold it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake! 3164
Then did the sorcerers fall down prostrate in adoration
Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds
"The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in him before I give you permission? Surely he is your leader who has taught you sorcery! But soon shall ye know! "But sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides and I will cause you all to die on the cross!" 3165

But there comes not to them a newly-revealed message from (Allah)
			Most Gracious but they turn away therefrom.
They said: "No matter! for us we shall but return to our Lord!
"Only our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults that we may become foremost among the Believers!" 3166
By inspiration We told Moses: "Travel by night with My servants; for surely ye shall be pursued." 3167
Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities
(Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band
"And they are raging furiously against us;
"But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
So We expelled them from gardens springs 3168
Treasures and every kind of honorable position;
Thus it was but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things. 3169
They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at! 3141
So they pursued them at sunrise. 3170

And when the two bodies saw each other the people of Moses said:
			"We are sure to be overtaken."
(Moses said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me! 3171

Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod."
			So it divided and each separate part become like the huge firm
			mass of a mountain.
And We made the other party approach thither. 3172
We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
But We drowned the others.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe. 3173
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful. 3174
And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story. 3175
Do they not look at the earth how many noble things of all kinds we have produced therein? 3142
Behold he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
They said: "We worship idols and we remain constantly in attendance on them." 3176
He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)
"Or do you good or harm?"

They said: "Nay but we found our fathers doing thus (what we
			do)."
He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping
"Ye and your fathers before you?
"For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds; 3177
"Who created me and it is He Who guides me;
"Who gives me food and drink
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
"And when I am ill it is He Who cures me;
"Who will cause me to die and then to live (again);

"And Who I hope will forgive me my faults on the Day of
			Judgment...
O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me and join me with the righteous; 3178
"Grant me honorable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations); 3179
"Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
"Forgive my father for that he is among those astray;

"And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be
			raised up
The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail 3180
"But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
And verily thy Lord is He the Exalted in Might Most Merciful. 3143
"To the righteous the Garden will be brought near 3181

"And to those straying in Evil the Fire will be placed in full
			view;

"And it shall be said to them: `Where are the (gods) ye
			worshipped
" `Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'
"Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire) they and those straying in Evil 3182
"And the whole hosts of Iblis together.
"They will say there in their mutual bickerings:
" `By Allah we were truly in an error manifest 3183
" `When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;
" `And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt. 3184
